com.topcoder.security.authenticationfactory
Class TimeoutCacheFactory

java.lang.Object
  com.topcoder.security.authenticationfactory.TimeoutCacheFactory
All Implemented Interfaces:
CacheFactory
public class TimeoutCacheFactory
extends java.lang.Object
implements CacheFactory

TimeoutCacheFactory class implements the CacheFactory interface, which will return a timeout simple cache. The createCache method will return a SimpleCache instance from the Simple Cache component with the specified time out, SimpleCache.NO_MAX_SIZE, and LRUCacheEvictStrategy. If the time out is 0, SimpleCache.NO_TIMEOUT will be used instead, indicating the entries in the cache will never timeout.

Version:
2.0
Author:
TCSDESIGNER, TCSDEVELOPER

           Create a TimeoutCacheFactory instance from the given namespace.This construct will get value from 'timeout' property of config file.

Constructor Detail

TimeoutCacheFactory

public TimeoutCacheFactory(long timeout)

Create a TimeoutCacheFactory with the timeout.

Parameters:
timeout - the timeout value for the cache, in milliseconds.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the timeout is negative.

TimeoutCacheFactory

public TimeoutCacheFactory(java.lang.String namespace)
                    throws ConfigurationException

Create a TimeoutCacheFactory instance from the given namespace.This construct will get value from 'timeout' property of config file.

Parameters:
namespace - the namespace from which to load the timeout value.
Throws:
java.lang.NullPointerException - if the namespace is null.
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the namespace is empty string.
ConfigurationException - if fail to load the timeout value, or the timeout value is invalid.
Method Detail

createCache

public com.topcoder.util.cache.Cache createCache()

Return the created Cache instance. If the timeout variable is 0, SimpleCache.NO_TIMEOUT will be used instead.

Specified by:
createCache in interface CacheFactory
Returns:
the Cache instance of the specified timeout.
